shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
September 8 at 2:30 PM 路

MECHS will begin Phase Two of our Pandemic Response Plan on September 14th by transitioning into the "Switch-Back Hike" or hybrid model. Students will have the choice of returning to campus or remaining in the virtual learning platform. Students will have the ability to switch from in-person or virtual learning as desired. Each Thursday will be dedicated to virtual learning to make the transition smoother. Be on the lookout for more information and details to come! We can't wait to see you back at school.
text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
September 8 at 2:30 PM 路

MECHS will begin Phase Two of our Pandemic Response Plan on September 14th by transitioning into the "Switch-Back Hike" or hybrid model. Students will have the choice of returning to campus or remaining in the virtual learning platform. Students will have the ability to switch from in-person or virtual learning as desired. Each Thursday will be dedicated to virtual learning to make the transition smoother. Be on the lookout for more information and details to come! We can't wait to see you back at school.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
September 9 at 5:03 PM 路

Please see the attached flyer that will be presented to students who are sent home from school (for a Remote Hike). Students presenting signs or symptoms of COVID-19 or that have had a risk of exposure will be sent home to work virtually. Just becuase we send students home does not mean that the student has COVID-19 or that they should stop working in their coursework. We will always encourage the student to work from home until they can return to campus.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 30 at 5:40 PM 路

Congratulations to Shyanna Holcomb from the Pickens Site! Shyanna came to MECHS from Pickens High School and was in search of a way to graduate early. Shyanna loved MECHS once she transferred because the teachers were all helpful and pushed her to get graduated. Shyanna says that Mrs. Zuidema and her parents are the reason she got to achieve her goals and graduate. Shyanna plans to attend Tennessee State where she will study to enter into the medical field. She wants to extend a special thanks to everyone at MECHS who helped her reach her goals. #classof2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance #highschoolgraduation

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 10 at 2:07 PM 路

Jacob Reed is a Class of 2020 graduate from the Pickens Site. Jacob has a passion for Nascar and a 2300 car collection from various drivers. Jacob has traveled to several tracks, and last year Bob Levine invited him and his dad to Martinsville where they sat in the pits and met many drivers and teams. Jacob was the 18th graduate from the Pickens Site this year. Congratulations on your hard work! We wish you the best in your future endeavors. #classof2020 #graduation #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance #seniorspotlight

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 4 at 1:49 PM 路

Alexis Mulkey is a Class of 2020 graduate from the Pickens Site. She plans to attend Chattahoochee Tech to complete her core classes then transfer to Reinhardt University for the nursing program. Her goal is to work in a trauma hospital or be a trauma flight medic. Alexis is interested in dancing, boxing, and drawing. Her favorite memory at MECHS was being able to make new friends. Alexis says that all the teachers at MECHS were willing to help make any student succeed. Congratulations Alexis, we wish you the best in your future endeavours. #classof2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mountaineducationcharter #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad #1stchoicefor2ndchance #graduate

post_text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Monday, June 8 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag, you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
April 17 at 5:38 PM 路

MECHS is working diligently to provide the safest option for a commencement ceremony for the spring of 2020. Graduation was originally scheduled for May 30th; however, due to the current situation with COVID-19 graduation will either be postponed until later this summer or we will host a virtual ceremony. With that being said, Dr. Lovell and everyone at MECHS would prefer to host traditional graduation with virtual being the absolute last resort. We are working with the University of North Georgia for potential new dates and times. Once we have more guidance from Governor Kemp and the Department of Education, we will communicate that to all of you. Please be assured that graduation will be happening whether at a later date or virtually.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
March 30 at 9:17 PM 路

If you find yourself feeling isolated, worried about your family, concerned about being alone at home with children for days or weeks, or in need of essential resources like food or funds for utilities and rent, please call 1-800-CHILDREN (244-5373). MECHS counselors are also available to families and students during this time. Lets navigate this new normal together.

post_text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.
text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

post_text: The health and wellness of students and staff is top priority. Under guidance from Gov. Kemps Office, MECHS will close all sites the week of March 16th. On Thursday, March 19th, MECHS will re-evaluate, MECHS will offer online learning opportunities while closed. Students should refer to the school website for further directions on online opportunities.

post_text: The Pickens site had a special visitor tonight. Blake Childers, a 2019 graduate, came to see us after completing Marine Recruit Training. His recruiter was very excited to tell us that Blake was meritoriously promoted to a Private 1st Class E-2 during Recruit Training. A meritorious promotion is based on the individual Marines ability to take on the responsibilities and duties of a higher grade in an effective manner. His recruiter said this doesn't happen very often. We are so proud of you, Blake!

post_text: Student appreciation starts Tuesday. All students should take our special survey on Monday. Based on the number of votes, the top four staff members chosen will either have a pie to the face, hit with water balloons or have to wear Ms. G's signature orange lipstick all evening. Students will be chosen at random. Be sure to vote on Monday. Event will be Livestreamed on Tuesday.

Mountain Education Charter High School student appreciation days begins on Tuesday, February 12th. We have a great evening planned for the 12th and lots of surprises for the following 9 school days.

On the 12th: Students voted for Panda Express for dinner. We will have a "special musical guest". We will be drawing for tons of gift cards including some $50.00 Walmart cards.

We hope students are as excited about the appreciation days as the staff of the Pickens site.

post_text: Mary Roden was selected as Staff Member of the Month by the Student Voice team. The students said she is the "jack of all trades." They said, "Not only is she really nice and shows us she cares by getting to know us, she is always serving us dinner, helping other teachers, teaching us...she just never stops doing stuff and helping others!"

post_text: Do you have a family member or friend under 21 that did not get their high school diploma? Are they interested in taking this important life step? Let Mountain Education Charter High School help you achieve this goal. Earn your diploma from a fully accredited high school that has nontraditional hours. Call us at 706-253-1750 or come by after 4:00 M-Th. We look forward to hearing from you!

post_text: At MECHS, we believe that the social and emotional development of our students is an important part of their academic growth. Great job students and mentors.

post_text: Pickens site had a great time at our holiday dinner! Thank you to everyone that donated prizes. We were able to give a prize to every student in attendance!

post_text: The Pickens site of MECHS will make a decision tomorrow by 10 a.m. regarding whether school will be open on Monday night.

post_text: Parents and students please join us as our guest on December 13th at 6:30 for our annual holiday dinner at the Pickens site. We will giving out student awards with drawings for prizes for students and parents. Dinner will be prepared by Mary Ann's Restaurant.

post_text: See you all today at 3:30!

post_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School Pickens Site will be closed today, Monday December 3rd due to technical issues.
We hope to have internet service restored by Tuesday.

post_text: Some of our Students of the Month: Michael Gay, Austin Hudson, Cupper Johnson. Way to go, guys!
text: Some of our Students of the Month: Michael Gay, Austin Hudson, Cupper Johnson. Way to go, guys!

post_text:
Alice Qualls was nominated as the Staff Member of the Month. Quotes from some of our students:
She is always so friendly and remembers every one of our names!
She really cares and asks about how day has been at work and she really listens.
She puts others first.
